title: Compliance chief at Chinese fintech company stole girlfriend's insider info to trade VMware, tech stocks
description: The head of compliance for a Chinese fintech company pleaded guilty to federal insider trading charges.

title: Pokemon Go maker Niantic lays off 230 employees, cancels games
description: Niantic, a San Francisco-based mobile games developer, announced it would lay off 230 employees as part of a reorganization.

title: Three charged with insider trading ahead of Trump Media SPAC deal
description: Michael Shvartsman, Gerald Shvartsman, and Bruce Garelick allegedly reaped more than $22 million in illegal profits from insider trading.

title: Tech IPO drought reaches 18 months despite Nasdaq's sharp rebound in first half of 2023
description: Even with tech stocks rallying this year after a brutal 2022, internet and software companies are steering clear of the IPO market.

title: Minecraft developers quit Reddit after company's controversial changes
description: In the latest blow to Reddit after its API billing changes, the makers of Minecraft — one of the best-selling video games of all time — have quit the platform.

title: Supreme Court rejects affirmative action at colleges as unconstitutional
description: The Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action at Harvard and the University of North Carolina is a blow to efforts to boost enrollment of racial minorities.

title: Sweden’s krona hits new record low as central bank hikes and plays down currency intervention
description: The policy rate now sits at 3.75% and the figure is in line with forecasts made by analysts polled by Reuters.

title: First-quarter economic growth was actually 2%, up from 1.3% first reported in major GDP revision
description: The U.S. economy showed much stronger-than-expected growth in the first quarter than previously thought.

title: Israel's Netanyahu concerned its defense systems may reach Iran if sent to Ukraine
description: Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu hinted that if defense systems used by Ukrainian forces were to fall into Russian hands, they could end up in Iran.

title: A shipping emissions showdown stands in the way of one of the biggest climate deals of the decade
description: The U.N.'s International Maritime Organization is expected to update its current shipping emissions target, but many are concerned about the pace of the cuts.

title: Asian chip stocks rally after Micron's bullish forecast signals easing supply glut
description: Shares of Asian chipmakers rallied after Micron's earnings beat estimates on the back of higher demand for its memory chips driven by the growing A.I. sector.

title: Huawei says applying 5G technology to business was more difficult than expected
description: Huawei's Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou said Wednesday that applying 5G to business was more difficult than she had expected.

title: Asia pushes back on 'excessive' currency moves amid enduring dollar strength
description: Japan, Malaysia and China officials have taken steps to push back this week against bets that have dragged their currencies to multi-month lows.
